System Design Engineering - University of Waterloo

Who I am is not defined by man. Who I am is defined by what kind of man I choose to be.

Hi there! I am a student at the University of Waterloo studying System Design Engineering. As an engineering student, I am excited to be learning a diverse variety of skills, from software development to solution architecture. My ultimate goal is to be developing solutions for problems that stretch beyond the scope of a traditional engineer and to help make the world a better place. I want to work with issues such as poverty, food security and public healthcare - but with a systematic and technical perspective. I love to meet new people and explore new things, so feel free to get in touch!

See my résumé

A collection of some projects I've worked on in hopes of improving in my craft.

  • Rob Ford the Game

    Co-created the viral game at HackNY. Received over 140,000 plays and international media coverage (like this article). Responsible for design and implementation of JavaScript code. Try it now and party like Rob Ford!

    Github

  • Yummly Rec-Sys

    A combined passion of food and programming to evaluate the Mortar Data recommendation engine (which I helped build) as a dive into the world of machine learning and data science. Developed web crawlers, recommender systems and analyitcal scripts.

    Github

  • Medidata

    Developed at MHacks. Medidata is a system developed for communities in 3rd world countries to report their medical needs to health providers through text messaging. The project received an award for Best Use of MongoDB.

    Github

  • Electric Piano

    This was a final project for a lab course I took in my first year of Engineering at Waterloo. It uses an FPGA board to control the frequency of two speakers by simply sending a binary signal at controlled oscillations. Here's the demo video!

  • Myophysio

    Submission at the Next36 Wearable Hackathon. MyoPhysio is a physiotherapy tool for patients to use at home to gain better feedback of recovery exercises. Was part of the first round of public developers on Thalmic Lab's Myo.

  • Manuscripter

    A web app that acts as a tool which provides biblical text without any annotations to provide plain, old Scripture. Try it out!

    Github

  • Talklight

    Talk Light is an experiment to analyze a room's lighting. The project uses technology like Arduion, Flask, MongoDB and Backbone.

    Github

  • Play on Time

    Play On Time is a metronome application that has been developed for Sony Smartwatch. It uses the built in vibrator to generate timed pulses.

    Github

  • Personal Website

    Designed and built my personal website from scratch. You're looking at it now!

    Github

There are other projects I have made, but they are not displayed here. Checkout my github to see what else I have done and am currently doing!

I believe it's important to channel passion into words so that words will one day lead to action. I hope to write thoughts on my streams of passion, whether it be technology, food or things of even greater importance. Welcome to my canvas of ideas.
